title: Pixel 1 bootloop
content:
My much-loved Pixel 1 is stuck in a bootloop - it loads up the Google logo, occasionally gets as far as showing the G, and then loops again. It has occasionally started up before crashing and bootlooping. I can get into the recovery screen, and once I'm there the phone is stable. This is what I've tried:
- Tried restarting plugged into a charger, to rule out battery problems. Didn't work.
- I've done a factory reset from the recovery screen, which didn't fix it.
- I sideloaded the latest OTA image from Google - which gave me a tantalising 15mins of my phone restoring settings etc, and then it has got stuck in a bootloop again.
- Left powered off overnight, in case it was overheating. Didn't work.

Anything else worth trying before I give up the ghost with the phone? I was hoping that the fact I can get the recovery screen up means it's a software issue, but I know some of these phones have a bootloop caused by hardware problems :(
